p: Colchicine (Colcrys®) is an alkaloid isolated from the plant Colchicum autumnale. It is a drug used to treat gout and Behçet's disease with narrow therapeutic-toxicity window and a marked variability between individuals in drug disposition [ 87]. Colchicine binds in an equimolar and poorly reversible manner to soluble nonpolymerized tubulin with high activation energy, forming a tubulin-colchicine complex [ 88].
